verses.verse: The words <WH1697> of Agur <WH94> the son <WH1121> of Jakeh <WH3348>, even the prophecy <WH4853>: the man <WH1397> spoke <WH5002> unto Ithiel <WH384>, even unto Ithiel <WH384> and Ucal <WH401>,
Surely I am more brutish <WH1198> than any man <WH376>, and have not the understanding <WH998> of a man <WH120>.
I neither learned <WH3925> wisdom <WH2451>, nor have <WH3045> the knowledge <WH1847> of the holy <WH6918>.

Who has ascended up <WH5927> into heaven <WH8064>, or descended <WH3381>? who has gathered <WH622> the wind <WH7307> in his fists <WH2651>? who has bound <WH6887> the waters <WH4325> in a garment <WH8071>? who has established <WH6965> all the ends <WH657> of the earth <WH776>? what is his name <WH8034>, and what is his son <WH1121>'s name <WH8034>, if you can tell <WH3045>?
Every word <WH565> of God <WH433> is pure <WH6884>: he is a shield <WH4043> unto them that put their trust in him <WH2620>.
Add <WH3254> you not unto his words <WH1697>, lest he reprove <WH3198> you <WH3576>, and you be found a liar.
Two <WH8147> things have I required <WH7592> of you <WH4513>; deny me them not before I die <WH4191>:
Remove far <WH7368> from me vanity <WH7723> and lies <WH1697>: give <WH5414> me neither poverty <WH7389> nor riches <WH6239>; feed <WH2963> me with food <WH3899> convenient for me <WH2706>:

Lest I be full <WH7646>, and deny <WH3584> you <WH559>, and say, Who is the Lord <WH3068>? or lest I be poor <WH3423>, and steal <WH1589>, and take <WH8610> the name <WH8034> of my God in vain <WH430>.
Accuse <WH3960> not a servant <WH5650> unto his master <WH113>, lest he curse <WH7043> you <WH816>, and you be found guilty.
There is a generation <WH1755> that curses <WH7043> their father <WH1>, and does not bless <WH1288> their mother <WH517>.
There is a generation <WH1755> that are pure <WH2889> in their own eyes <WH5869>, and yet is not washed <WH7364> from their filthiness <WH6675>.
There is a generation <WH1755>, O how lofty <WH7311> are their eyes <WH5869>! and their eyelids <WH6079> are lifted up <WH5375>.

There is a generation <WH1755>, whose teeth <WH8127> are as swords <WH2719>, and their jaw teeth <WH4973> as knives <WH3979>, to devour <WH398> the poor <WH6041> from off the earth <WH776>, and the needy <WH34> from among men <WH120>.

The horseleach <WH5936> has two <WH8147> daughters <WH1323>, crying <WH3051>, Give, give <WH3051>. There are three <WH7969> things that are never satisfied <WH7646>, Yes <WH702>, four things say <WH559> not <WH1952>, It is enough:
The grave <WH7585>; and the childless <WH6115> womb <WH7356>; the earth <WH776> that is not filled <WH7646> with water <WH4325>; and the fire <WH784> that says <WH559> not <WH1952>, It is enough.

The eye <WH5869> that mocks <WH3932> at his father <WH1>, and despises <WH936> to obey <WH3349> his mother <WH517>, the ravens <WH6158> of the valley <WH5158> shall pick it out <WH5365>, and the young <WH1121> eagles <WH5404> shall eat it <WH398>.
There be three <WH7969> things which are too wonderful <WH6381> for me <WH702>, Yes, four which I know not <WH3045>:

The way <WH1870> of a eagle <WH5404> in the air <WH8064>; the way <WH1870> of a serpent <WH5175> upon a rock <WH6697>; the way <WH1870> of a boat <WH591> in the middle <WH3820> of the sea <WH3220>; and the way <WH1870> of a man <WH1397> with a maid <WH5959>.
Such is the way <WH1870> of a adulterous <WH5003> woman <WH802>; she eats <WH398>, and wipes <WH4229> her mouth <WH6310>, and says <WH559>, I have done <WH6466> no wickedness <WH205>.
For three <WH7969> things the earth <WH776> is disquieted <WH7264>, and for four <WH702> which it cannot <WH3201> carry <WH5375>:
For a servant <WH5650> when he reigns <WH4427>; and a fool <WH5036> when he is filled <WH7646> with food <WH3899>;
For a odious <WH8130> woman when she is married <WH1166>; and a handmaid <WH8198> that is heir <WH3423> to her mistress <WH1404>.
There be four <WH702> things which are little <WH6996> upon the earth <WH776>, but they are exceedingly <WH2449> wise <WH2450>:
The ants <WH5244> are a people <WH5971> not strong <WH5794>, yet they prepare <WH3559> their food <WH3899> in the summer <WH7019>;
The conies <WH8227> are but a feeble <WH6099> folk <WH5971>, yet make <WH7760> they their houses <WH1004> in the rocks <WH5553>;
The locusts <WH697> have no king <WH4428>, yet go they forth <WH3318> all of them by bands <WH2686>;
The spider <WH8079> takes hold <WH8610> with her hands <WH3027>, and is in kings <WH4428>' palaces <WH1964>.
There be three <WH7969> things which go <WH6806> well <WH3190>, Yes <WH702>, four are fitting <WH2895> in going <WH3212>:
A lion <WH3918> which is strongest <WH1368> among animals <WH929>, and turns not away <WH7725> for any <WH6440>;
A greyhound <WH4975>; a he goat <WH8495> also <WH176>; and a king <WH4428>, against whom there is no rising up <WH510>.
If you have done foolishly <WH5034> in lifting up <WH5375> yourself <WH2161>, or if you have thought evil, lay your hand <WH3027> upon your mouth <WH6310>.

Surely the churning <WH4330> of milk <WH2461> brings forth <WH3318> butter <WH2529>, and the wringing <WH4330> of the nose <WH639> brings forth <WH3318> blood <WH1818>: so the forcing <WH4330> of wrath <WH639> brings forth <WH3318> strife <WH7379>.
